theorem.name: belBT_inductive_clause

text.english: Inductive clause of the definition of \(\texttt{belBT}\): \begin{multline} \forall t_1,t_2 \in BT_A.\; \forall a,b \in A .\\ \texttt{belBT}(N(t_1, a, t_2),  b) = \begin{cases} \texttt{true} & \text{if}\; a == b\\ \texttt{belBT}(t1, b) \vee \texttt{belBT}(t2, b) & \text{otherwise}\end{cases} \end{multline}
text.italiano: Clausola induttiva della definizione di \(\texttt{belBT}\): \begin{multline} \forall t_1,t_2 \in BT_A.\; \forall a,b \in A .\\ \texttt{belBT}(N(t_1, a, t_2), b) = \begin{cases} \texttt{true} & \text{if}\; a == b\\ \texttt{belBT}(t1, b) \vee \texttt{belBT}(t2, b) & \text{otherwise}\end{cases} \end{multline}

theorem.coq:
Theorem belBT_inductive_clause : forall (t1 t2 : bte) , forall (a b : A) , belBT (N t1 a t2) b = if a == b then true else belBT t1 b || belBT t2 b.
Proof.
reflexivity.
Qed.
